title: Calories in 1 Scrambled Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 scrambled egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), scrambled with 1 tsp butter, no milk or added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and ingredients like milk or cheese. Check recipes or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One scrambled large egg has about 110 kcal and 6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use 1 tsp oil instead of butter

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 110 kcal for a large egg scrambled with 1 tsp butter.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 6.3 g of protein per scrambled egg.

faqs.q: Does scrambling add calories to an egg?
faqs.a: Yes, added fats like butter increase calories from the base ~72 kcal raw egg.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs high in fat?
faqs.a: Around 9.2 g total fat per egg, mostly from the yolk and cooking fat.

faqs.q: How does milk affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Adding 1 tbsp milk adds ~8 kcal; it also slightly increases carbs.
